      The adapter to the view

    • registry

      private Registry registry
      The local Registry

    • helloServer

      private IHello helloServer
      The RMI Server implementation -- the actual object that will do the processing. Using an anonymous inner class to implement the RMI Server object to show how it can close over needed resources, e.g. the logger.

    • helloStub

      private IHello helloStub
      The stub of the IHello RMI Server object

    • currentConfig

      private RMIPortConfigWithBoundName currentConfig
      The currently selected app config.

  • Constructor Details

    • HelloModelServer

      public HelloModelServer(ILogger logger, RMIPortConfigWithBoundName currentConfig, IModel2ViewAdapterServer m2vAdpt)
      Construct the model
      Parameters:
      logger - The system logger
      currentConfig - The currently selected app config
      m2vAdpt - The adapter to the view

  • Method Details

    • getRMIUtils

      public IRMIUtils getRMIUtils()
      Get the internal IRMIUtils instance being used. The discovery model start method needs the main model's IRMIUtils. ONLY call the method AFTER the model, i.e. the internal IRMIUtils, has been started!
      Returns:
      The internal IRMIUtils instance

    • start

      public void start()
      Start the model

    • run

      public void run()
      Run the Server, which will find the RMI Registry, creating it if necessary, and bind an instance of the Server to the "Hello" name in the Registry. The server then stays in an infinite loop waiting for someone to use the bound server.

    • quit

      public void quit(int exitCode)
      Stop the RMI system and quit the app with the given exit code.
      Parameters:
      exitCode - Exit code: 0 = normal, -1 = error
